purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of data that tracks selected parts as an assembly and to note when some of those parts are not installed. An attachment slot represents the position in which a part is or can be attached to an assembly, when it is necessary to record the history of usage of that attachment slot.
purpose.note: For the purposes of this standard, a part is either an indivisible component or an assembly of such components.
purpose.example: A ship has four engines each attached at a mounting point in an engine room. These mounting points each has an associated attachment slot, which are identified as attachment slot 1, attachment slot 2, attachment slot 3, and attachment slot 4. In normal usage only two main engines are are operating, the remaining two provide an operating enhancement if all four operate or a backup for the two main engines. The attached engines are tracked against their respective attachment slots. If the ship does not have all of its engines installed, one or more attachment slots are empty. An empty attachment slot is subject to a different maintenance regime than an installed engine.

The pylon mounting on an aircraft wing is used to carry a radar, or fuel tank. The mounting has an associated attachment slot. The fatigue life of the mounting will be determined differently depending on what is fitted at the attachment slot and the duration of operating in that configuration which could be based on flying hours, landings, the calendar or some other measure.
purpose.p: An attachment slot may be identified whenever there two parts that are physically interfaced. If the details of this interface are required then the attachment slot may be associated with applicable instances of the and entity data types.

An attachment slot has an identification and may have one or more versions (), and each may have one or more applicable view definitions (). An attachment slot version may exist in the form of a designed attachment slot (), a planned attachment slot () and realized attachment slot ().
The relationships and identify which part or parts attach at an attachment slot and on which part the attachment slot is a location at which to attach one or more other parts.

purpose.note: One attachment slot may have more than one associated connector.
purpose.example: A pylon mounting on an aircraft wing provides connectivity of electrical, hydraulic and fuel services between the aircraft and a range of equipment that can attach to the pylon mounting.

inscope.li: identification of positions within an assembly of parts to which component parts may be attached;
identification of parts that are attached to identified positions within an assembly.

outscope.li: products that have no physical interface;
products that have a physical interface, but there is no requirement to identify and distinguish between occasions on which specific parts are attached at that interface.

definition.def: the position in which a part is or can be attached to an assembly, when it is necessary to record the history of usage of that attachment slot
